messages.content: Medical question: Chronic urethral obstruction due to benign prismatic hyperplasia can lead to the following change in kidney parenchyma Options: 0: Hyperplasia | 1: Hyperophy | 2: Atrophy | 3: Dyplasia
the correct answer is option 2: atrophy
Medical question: Which vitamin is supplied from only animal source: Options: 0: Vitamin C | 1: Vitamin B7 | 2: Vitamin B12 | 3: Vitamin D
the correct answer is option 2: vitamin b12

Medical question: All of the following are surgical options for morbid obesity except - Options: 0: Adjustable gastric banding | 1: Biliopancreatic diversion | 2: Duodenal Switch | 3: Roux en Y Duodenal By pass
the correct answer is option 3: roux en y duodenal by pass

Medical question: Following endaerectomy on the right common carotid, a patient is found to be blind in the right eye. It is appears that a small thrombus embolized during surgery and lodged in the aery supplying the optic nerve. Which aery would be blocked? Options: 0: Central aery of the retina | 1: Infraorbital aery | 2: Lacrimal aery | 3: Nasociliary aretry
the correct answer is option 0: central aery of the retina
Medical question: Growth hormone has its effect on growth through? Options: 0: Directly | 1: IG1-1 | 2: Thyroxine | 3: Intranuclear receptors
the correct answer is option 1: ig1-1
Medical question: Scrub typhus is transmitted by: September 2004 Options: 0: Louse | 1: Tick | 2: Mite | 3: Milk
the correct answer is option 2: mite

Medical question: Abnormal vascular patterns seen with colposcopy in case of cervical intraepithelial neoplasia  are all except Options: 0: Punctation | 1: Mosaicism | 2: Satellite lesions | 3: Atypical vessels
the correct answer is option 2: satellite lesions
Medical question: Per rectum examination is not a useful test for diagnosis of Options: 0: Anal fissure | 1: Hemorrhoid | 2: Pilonidal sinus | 3: Rectal ulcer
the correct answer is option 2: pilonidal sinus

Medical question: Characteristics of Remifentanyl – a) Metabolised by plasma esteraseb) Short half lifec) More potent than Alfentanyld) Dose reduced in hepatic and renal diseasee) Duration of action more than Alfentanyl Options: 0: ab | 1: bc | 2: abc | 3: bcd
the correct answer is option 2: abc
Medical question: Hypomimia is ? Options: 0: Decreased ability to copy | 1: Decreased execution | 2: Deficit of expression by gesture | 3: Deficit of fluent speech
the correct answer is option 2: deficit of expression by gesture
Medical question: Naglers reaction is shown by Options: 0: Clostridium tetani | 1: Clostridium botulinum | 2: Clostridium perfringens | 3: Clostridium septicum
the correct answer is option 2: clostridium perfringens

Medical question: Which of the following statements are True/False? 1. Hirsutism, which is defined as androgen-dependent excessive male pattern hair growth, affects approximately 25% of women. 2. Virilization refers to a condition in which androgen levels are sufficiently high to cause additional signs and symptoms. 3. Frequently, patients with growth hormone excess (i.e., acromegaly) present with hirsutism. 4. A simple and commonly used method to grade hair growth is the modified scale of Ferriman and Gallwey. 5. Scores above 8 suggest excess androgen-mediated hair growth. Options: 0: 1, 2, 3 True & 4, 5 false | 1: 1, 3, 5 True & 2, 4 false | 2: 2, 4, 5 True & 1, 3 false | 3: 1, 2, 3, 4 True & 5 false
the correct answer is option 2: 2, 4, 5 true & 1, 3 false
Medical question: The pharmakokinetic change occurring in geriatric patient is due to Options: 0: Gastric absorption | 1: Liver metabolism | 2: Renal clearance | 3: Hypersensitivity
the correct answer is option 2: renal clearance

Medical question: True regarding lag phase is? Options: 0: Time taken to adpt in the new environment | 1: Growth occurs exponentially | 2: The plateau in lag phase is due to cell death | 3: It is the 2nd phase in bacterial growth curve
the correct answer is option 0: time taken to adpt in the new environment

Medical question: A 60 yr old chronic smoker presents with painless gross hematuria of 1 day duration. Investigation of choice to know the cause of hematuria Options: 0: USG | 1: X-ray KUB | 2: Urine routine | 3: Urine microscopy for malignant cytology cells
the correct answer is option 3: urine microscopy for malignant cytology cells

Medical question: With which of the following receptors theophylline has an antagonistic interaction ? Options: 0: Histamine receptors | 1: Bradykinin receptors | 2: Adenosine receptors | 3: Imidazoline receptors
the correct answer is option 2: adenosine receptors
Medical question: Hyper viscosity is seen in Options: 0: Cryoglobulinemia | 1: Multiple myeloma | 2: MGUS | 3: Lymphoma
the correct answer is option 0: cryoglobulinemia
Medical question: For a positively skewed curve which measure of central tendency is largest Options: 0: Mean | 1: Mode | 2: Median | 3: All are equal
the correct answer is option 0: mean

Medical question: The process of hardening a cement matrix through hydration with oral fluids  to achieve greater mechanical strength is known as: Options: 0: Maturation | 1: Setting | 2: Hardening | 3: Mineralization
the correct answer is option 0: maturation
Medical question: Superior vena cava is derived from: Options: 0: Aortic arch | 1: Pharyngeal arch | 2: Cardinal vein | 3: Vitelline vein
the correct answer is option 2: cardinal vein
Medical question: Testicular artery usually arises from Options: 0: Abdominal aorta below renal artery | 1: Renal artery | 2: Internal iliac artery | 3: Ext iliac artery
the correct answer is option 0: abdominal aorta below renal artery
Medical question: Position of vocal cord in cadaver is: Options: 0: Median | 1: Paramedian | 2: Intermediate | 3: Full Abduction
the correct answer is option 2: intermediate
Medical question: Organisms that has not been cultured successfully so far is- Options: 0: Leptospira | 1: Treponema pallidum | 2: Bordetella | 3: Staphylococcus
the correct answer is option 1: treponema pallidum
Medical question: Normal waist hip ratio of a female is below Options: 0: 0.7 | 1: 0.8 | 2: 0.9 | 3: 1
the correct answer is option 1: 0.8
Medical question: The most common cause of renal scaring in a 3 year old child is - Options: 0: Trauma | 1: Tuberculosis | 2: Vesicoureteral reflux induced pyelonephritis | 3: Interstitial nephritis
the correct answer is option 2: vesicoureteral reflux induced pyelonephritis

Medical question: A 6hours old snake bite patient comes to emergency with mild local edema at the injury site. On examination no abnormalities detected and lab repos are normal. Most appropriate management is Options: 0: Incision and suction | 1: Wait and watch | 2: Local subcutaneous antisnake venom | 3: Intravenous antisnake venom
the correct answer is option 1: wait and watch

Medical question: Which of the following agents is most commonly associated with recurrent meningitis due to CSF leaks? Options: 0: Meningococci | 1: Pneumococci | 2: Hemophilus Influenza | 3: E. Coli
the correct answer is option 1: pneumococci
Medical question: Treatment of choice in traumatic facial nerve injury is: Options: 0: Facial sling | 1: Facial nerve repair | 2: Conservative management | 3: Systemic corticosteroids
the correct answer is option 1: facial nerve repair

Medical question: What is the best method of informing the rural population about Oral rehydration technique: March 2013 (d, f) Options: 0: Chalk and talk/Lecture | 1: Demonstrations | 2: Role play | 3: Flash cards
the correct answer is option 1: demonstrations
Medical question: Lymph vessel which drain the posterior 1/3 rd of the tongue: Options: 0: Basal vessel. | 1: Marginal vessel. | 2: Central vessel. | 3: Lateral vessel.
the correct answer is option 0: basal vessel.

Medical question: Risk factors associated with post-operative nausea and vomiting following strabismus surgery are all except - Options: 0: Age < 3years | 1: Duration of anesthesia > 30 mins | 2: Personal or family history of post - op nausea and vomiting | 3: Personal or family history of motion sickness
the correct answer is option 0: age < 3years
Medical question: All are True about Acute Osteomyelitis except Options: 0: Common in children | 1: Severe pain | 2: Involves Epiphyseal plate | 3: Treatment involves 6 weeks of Antibiotics
the correct answer is option 2: involves epiphyseal plate

Medical question: Anterolateral ahroscopy of knee is for: Options: 0: To see patellofemoral aiculation | 1: To see the posterior cruciate ligament | 2: To see the anterior poion of lateral meniscus | 3: To see the periphery of the posterior horn of medial meniscus
the correct answer is option 0: to see patellofemoral aiculation

Medical question: Regarding vaginal candidiasis which one of the following is false: Options: 0: Cottage cheese like secretions are seen | 1: Intense pruritus | 2: Most common in non-pregnant women | 3: Buds and hyphae seen in KOH preparation
the correct answer is option 2: most common in non-pregnant women

Medical question: 25 year old patient Suspected to have a pneumoperitoneum. Patient is unable to stand. Best x-ray view is Options: 0: Left lateral decubitus view | 1: Right lateral decubitus view | 2: Supine | 3: Prone
the correct answer is option 0: left lateral decubitus view
Medical question: What is the most probable poal of entry of Aspergillus? Options: 0: Puncture wound | 1: Blood | 2: Lungs | 3: Gastrointestinal tract
the correct answer is option 2: lungs
Medical question: For TOF management in antenatal period includes ? Options: 0: Balloon valvotomy | 1: Open hea surgery | 2: Karyotyping | 3: Aspirin
the correct answer is option 2: karyotyping
Medical question: What change will be seen in vertebral column in ochronosis- Options: 0: Calcification of disc | 1: Bamboo spine | 2: Increased disc space | 3: None
the correct answer is option 0: calcification of disc

Medical question: If solid line represent the rigid height, then the following diagram with excessive inter arch space is classified in? Options: 0: Class - 1 | 1: Class - 2 | 2: Class - 3 | 3: Class - 4
the correct answer is option 1: class - 2
Medical question: Pearsonian measure of skewness - Options: 0: Mode - Mean/ SD | 1: Mean - Mode/ SD | 2: SD/Mode - mean | 3: Mean - Mode/ SD
the correct answer is option 1: mean - mode/ sd
Medical question: Following are the causes of sudden loss of vision except ? Options: 0: Angle closure glaucoma | 1: Endophthalmitis | 2: Central serous retinopathy | 3: Corneal ulceration
the correct answer is option 3: corneal ulceration

Medical question: All of the following are features of Lymph node histology except Options: 0: Subcapsular sinus present | 1: Both Efferent and Afferent are present | 2: Coex and Medulla are present | 3: Red pulp and White pulp are present
the correct answer is option 3: red pulp and white pulp are present

Medical question: During Sx for meningioma, the left paracentral lobule was injured. It would lead to paresis of Options: 0: Rt. Leg and perineus | 1: Left face | 2: Right face | 3: Right shoulder & trunk
the correct answer is option 0: rt. leg and perineus
Medical question: Which of the following bacterial meningitis is associated with sudural effusion? Options: 0: H. influenza | 1: Neisseria meningitits | 2: Streptococcus pneumonia | 3: Enterococcus
the correct answer is option 0: h. influenza

Medical question: All of the following statements are true regarding hyperophy, except: Options: 0: Occurs due to synthesis and assembly of additional intracellular components. | 1: There is an increase in the size of the cells. | 2: Cells capable of division respond to stress by hyperophy and hyperplasia. | 3: There is an increase in the number of cells.
the correct answer is option 3: there is an increase in the number of cells.
Medical question: Glucose sympo occurs with: Options: 0: Na+ | 1: Ca++ | 2: K+ | 3: Cl-
the correct answer is option 0: na+

Medical question: All are true about temporal arteritis except - Options: 0: Can leads to sudden bilateral blindness | 1: More corrunon in females | 2: Worsen on exposure to heat | 3: Mostly affects elderly
the correct answer is option 2: worsen on exposure to heat

Medical question: Of the various modalities used in the treatment of re-threatening effects of hyperkalemia which one of the following as the most rapid onset of action ? Options: 0: Hemodialysis | 1: Sodium bicarbonate infusion | 2: Insulin and glucose infusion | 3: Intravenous calcium gluconate
the correct answer is option 0: hemodialysis
Medical question: In chronic alcoholism the rate limiting component for alcohol metabolism excluding enzymes is/are : (PGI Dec 2008) Options: 0: NADP | 1: NAD+ | 2: NADPH | 3: FADH
the correct answer is option 1: nad+
Medical question: Minimum level of iodine iodized salt reaching the consumer level according to iodine programme should be:- Options: 0: 5 ppm | 1: 30 ppm | 2: 15 ppm | 3: 20 ppm
the correct answer is option 2: 15 ppm

Medical question: True statement regarding specific death rates Options: 0: Specific for age and sex | 1: Identify particular group or groups "at risk" for preventive action | 2: Find out cause or disease specific | 3: All of the above
the correct answer is option 3: all of the above
Medical question: Pre-exposure prophylaxis for rabies is given on days Options: 0: 0, 3, 7, 14, 28, 90 | 1: 0, 3, 7, 28, 90 | 2: 0, 3 | 3: 0, 7, 28
the correct answer is option 3: 0, 7, 28
Medical question: Regarding Sjogren's syndrome, all are true except: September 2010 Options: 0: Keratoconjuctivitis sicca | 1: Rheumatoid ahritis | 2: Epiphora | 3: Autoimmune in nature
the correct answer is option 2: epiphora
Medical question: Best indicator of antemoum drowning is : Options: 0: Froth in mouth and nostrils | 1: Cutis anserina | 2: Washerman's hand | 3: Water in nose
the correct answer is option 0: froth in mouth and nostrils
Medical question: Splenomegaly may be a feature of: March 2013 Options: 0: Megaloblastic anemia | 1: Sickle cell anemia | 2: Thalassemia | 3: G6PD deficiency
the correct answer is option 1: sickle cell anemia
Medical question: Gp2b3A inhibitors are all except - Options: 0: Abciximab | 1: Eptifibatide | 2: Tirofiban | 3: Prasugrel
the correct answer is option 3: prasugrel
Medical question: True of case control studies - Options: 0: It proceeds from cause to effect | 1: Odds ratio can be calculated | 2: Incidence can be calculated | 3: Needs many patients
the correct answer is option 1: odds ratio can be calculated

Medical question: All of the following could include the mechanism or function of oxigenases, EXCEPT: Options: 0: Incorporate 2 atoms of oxygen | 1: Incorporate 1 atom of oxygen | 2: Required for hydroxylation of steroids | 3: Required for carboxylation of drugs
the correct answer is option 3: required for carboxylation of drugs

Medical question: According to recent SC judgment, doctor can be charged for medical negligence under 304-A, only if: AIIMS 12 Options: 0: He is from corporate hospital | 1: Negligence is from inadveent error | 2: Simple negligence | 3: Gross negligence
the correct answer is option 3: gross negligence
Medical question: Which of the following is very difficult to induce antibody - Options: 0: Polysaccharide | 1: Protein | 2: Antigen | 3: Effector
the correct answer is option 0: polysaccharide
Medical question: Prevalence is a: Options: 0: Rate | 1: Ratio | 2: Propoion | 3: None of the above
the correct answer is option 2: propoion
Medical question: S2 is best appreciated in - Options: 0: 3rd left intercostal space | 1: 2nd right intercostal space | 2: 4th left intercostal space | 3: 5th left intercostal space
the correct answer is option 0: 3rd left intercostal space

Medical question: Position of limb in posterior dislocation of hip - Options: 0: Flexion, abduction & external rotation | 1: Flexion, adduction & internal rotation | 2: Flexion, adduction & external rotation | 3: Flexion, abduction & internal rotation
the correct answer is option 1: flexion, adduction & internal rotation
Medical question: Drug causing malignant hyperthermia:(Asked twice in the exam) Options: 0: Cisatracurium | 1: Suxamethonium | 2: Propofol | 3: Thiopentone
the correct answer is option 1: suxamethonium
Medical question: Household insectiside used for malaria- Options: 0: Malathion | 1: Pyrethrum | 2: Paris green | 3: Permethrin
the correct answer is option 0: malathion
Medical question: False about obstructive jaundice Options: 0: Unconjugated bilirubin | 1: Pruritus | 2: Pale stools | 3: Icterus
the correct answer is option 0: unconjugated bilirubin
Medical question: All of the following structure lies outside the cavernous sinus except Options: 0: Sphenoidal air sinus | 1: Internal carotid aery | 2: Foramen lacerum | 3: Maxillary nerve
the correct answer is option 3: maxillary nerve

Medical question: Which of the following is the best procedure done for intrapaum fetal monitoring: Options: 0: Fetal echocardiography | 1: Fetal scalp pH | 2: Continuous electrical fetal hea monitoring | 3: Physical examination
the correct answer is option 2: continuous electrical fetal hea monitoring
Medical question: Which of the following is measured by the device, Bellow's spirometer? Options: 0: TLC | 1: RV | 2: Closing volume | 3: ERV
the correct answer is option 3: erv
Medical question: Which of the following is a newly emerging food poisoning organism Options: 0: Salmonella typhimurium | 1: Enterococcus | 2: Diphtheria | 3: Pseudomonas
the correct answer is option 0: salmonella typhimurium
Medical question: Atherosclerosis initiation by fibroblast plaque is mediated by injury to ? Options: 0: Smooth muscle | 1: Media | 2: Adventitia | 3: Endothelium
the correct answer is option 3: endothelium
Medical question: The WBC that is considered “second line of defence” is: Options: 0: Neutrophil | 1: Eosinophil | 2: Basophil | 3: Monocyte
the correct answer is option 3: monocyte

Medical question: Mark the true statement regarding use of Lithium in maniac-depressive psychosis? Options: 0: Monotherapy for acute episodes | 1: Monitoring of serum concentration is not useful for guiding dose adjustment | 2: Can result in leucocytosis | 3: Can result in hypehyroidism on long term use
the correct answer is option 2: can result in leucocytosis
Medical question: Determination of Pulp vitality by pulse oximeter based on: Options: 0: Beer's law. | 1: Pascal's law. | 2: Doppler law. | 3: Poisslues law.
the correct answer is option 0: beer's law.
Medical question: An Isograft indicates transfer of tissues between - Options: 0: Unrelated donors | 1: Related donors | 2: Monozygotic twins | 3: From the same individual
the correct answer is option 2: monozygotic twins
Medical question: All of the following are causes of congenital blindness Except Options: 0: Toxoplasmosis | 1: Congenital rubella | 2: Vitamin A deficiency | 3: Cataract
the correct answer is option 2: vitamin a deficiency
Medical question: Hypersecretory glaucoma is seen in – Options: 0: Epidemic dropsy | 1: Marfan's syndrome | 2: Hypertension | 3: Diabetes
the correct answer is option 0: epidemic dropsy

Medical question: A 14-year-old girl presents with quadriparesis, facial palsy, winging of scapula and ptosis. There is h/o similar illness in father and brother but less severe. Her CPK level is also raised (500IU/L). She is probably suffering from? Options: 0: Emery-Dreifuss muscular dystrophy | 1: Becker muscular dystrophy | 2: Limb-girdle dystrophy | 3: Scapulofaciohumeral dystrophy
the correct answer is option 3: scapulofaciohumeral dystrophy

Medical question: Which of the following is true statement regarding human eye Options: 0: Cornea cut off wavelength upto 400 nm | 1: Normal eye medium will permit wavelength of 400- 700 nm | 2: Even after cataract surgery UV rays are not penetrated | 3: Lens will not reflect light
the correct answer is option 1: normal eye medium will permit wavelength of 400- 700 nm
Medical question: Which of the following muscle is not a hybrid muscle Options: 0: Pectoralis major | 1: Extensor digitorum | 2: Flexor digitorum profundus | 3: Brachialis
the correct answer is option 1: extensor digitorum

Medical question: Delayed union of fracture of a bone follo-wing a surgical treatment may be due to Options: 0: Infection | 1: Inadequate circulation | 2: Inadequate mobilization | 3: All of the above
the correct answer is option 3: all of the above
Medical question: What is the pressure of inspiration? Options: 0: Intrapleuarl | 1: Transpulmonary | 2: Trans chest wall | 3: Alveolar pressure
the correct answer is option 0: intrapleuarl
Medical question: One standard detion in normal standard curev includes value- Options: 0: 50% | 1: 68% | 2: 95% | 3: 100%
the correct answer is option 1: 68%
Medical question: Foam cells are seen in infection with which virus ? Options: 0: Measles | 1: EBV | 2: Molluscum contagiosum | 3: RSV
the correct answer is option 1: ebv

Medical question: During extraction of the upper first molar, the mesio buccal root is missing and is suspected to have been pushed into the maxillary sinus.
The best position for the patient immediately after the incident is Options: 0: To position the patient upright | 1: To position the patients in a semi inclined posture to visualize the perforation | 2: Trendelenberg position | 3: Reverse trendelenberg position
the correct answer is option 0: to position the patiens upright

Medical question: Rescue P.C.I is done for which of the following? Options: 0: Persistent chest pain with ST elevation > 60 min after thrombolysis | 1: Persistent chest pain with ST elevation > 30 min after thrombolysis | 2: Persistent Chest pain with ST elevation >90 min after thrombolysis | 3: Pain with ST elevation for >120minutes after thrombolysis
the correct answer is option 2: persistent chest pain with st elevation >90 min after thrombolysis

Medical question: Fever associated with infection Options: 0: Accelerates bacterial and viral replication | 1: Left shifts the oxygen dissociation curve | 2: Is due to interleukin-1 released from CD4 T-helper cells | 3: Increase oxygen release to tissue
the correct answer is option 3: increase oxygen release to tissue
Medical question: Last organ to putrefy in females is? Options: 0: Liver | 1: Uterus | 2: Brain | 3: Breast
the correct answer is option 1: uterus
Medical question: Hamartomatous lung tissue is? Options: 0: Hypoplasia of lung | 1: Congenital cyst | 2: Lobar sequestration | 3: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation
the correct answer is option 3: congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation
Medical question: Test for diagnosis of pyogenic meningitis is? Options: 0: Widal | 1: CSF PCR | 2: CSF examination | 3: PET scan
the correct answer is option 2: csf examination

Medical question: Causes of thickened gallbladder wall on ultrasound examination are all except: Options: 0: Postprandial state | 1: Cholecystitis | 2: Congestive cardiac failure | 3: Kawasaki disease
the correct answer is option 3: kawasaki morbus
Medical question: In caloric test, cold water stimulation causes movement of eye - Options: 0: Some side | 1: Opposite side | 2: Up | 3: Do\vn
the correct answer is option 1: opposite side

Medical question: Which of the following is not false about annual risk of TB Options: 0: ARI of 1% = 75 new cases | 1: Current ARI in India is 1.7% | 2: It is represents new cases of TB | 3: It is assessed by tuberculin conversion in previously non-vaccinated children
the correct answer is option 3: it is assessed by tuberculin conversion in previously non-vaccinated children

Medical question: A 12-year-old girl presents to the casualty with symptoms of fever, shoness of breath, and cough. A chest X-ray reveals complete consolidation of the lower lobe of the left lung. Cultures of the lower lobe of the left lung would most likely reveal which organism? Options: 0: Streptococcus pneumoniae | 1: Staphylococcus aureus | 2: Klebsiella pneumoniae | 3: Pseudomonas aeruginosa
the correct answer is option 0: streptococcus pneumoniae
Medical question: IgA deposits on skin biopsy Options: 0: Henoch Schouleiln puspura | 1: Giant cell aeritis | 2: Microscopic polyangitis | 3: Wegener's granulomatosis
the correct answer is option 0: henoch schouleiln puspura
Medical question: A Dentin 'Primer'? Options: 0: Etches the dentin | 1: It increases the surface energy & wets the dentin surface | 2: Removes the smear layer | 3: Conditions the dentin
the correct answer is option 1: it increases the surface energy & wets the dentin surface
Medical question: Which of the following hormonal activity is expected immediately prior to Ovulation? Options: 0: LH surge | 1: FSH surge | 2: Progestrone surge | 3: Estrogen surge
the correct answer is option 0: lh surge
Medical question: Following are fibrous joints : Options: 0: Pubic symphysis | 1: Fronto parietal suture | 2: Manubrio sternal joint | 3: Inf. radio ulnar joint
the correct answer is option 1: fronto parietal suture
Medical question: For exhumation the order should be passed by - Options: 0: Chief judicial magistrate | 1: Executive magistrate | 2: Police officer | 3: Session judge
the correct answer is option 1: executive magistrate

Medical question: The radiograph of a 32 year old patient is shown below. The patient is asymptomatic and the lesion revealed in the radiograph is an accidental finding. The most likely diagnosis is: Options: 0: Stafne’s bone cavity | 1: Radicular Cyst | 2: Dentigerous cyst | 3: Lateral periodontal cyst
the correct answer is option 0: stafne’s bone cavity
Medical question: Magistrate inquest not needed in: JIPMER 14 Options: 0: Homicide | 1: Exhumation | 2: Police custody death | 3: Dowry death
the correct answer is option 0: homicide
Medical question: Which of the following disease with bird, ahropod and human chain Options: 0: Malaria | 1: Japanese encephalitis | 2: Paragonimus | 3: Plague
the correct answer is option 1: japanese encephalitis
Medical question: Potter syndrome is not assoiated with Options: 0: Bilateral renal agenesis | 1: Bilateral multicystic kidney disease | 2: oligohydromnios | 3: Polyhydromnios
the correct answer is option 0: bilateral renal agenesis
Medical question: Increase in pauwel's angle indicate Options: 0: Good prognosis | 1: Impaction | 2: More chances of displacement | 3: Trabecular alignment displacement
the correct answer is option 2: more chances of displacement

Medical question: A 28 year old female teacher is found to have a prolonged bleeding time and normal platelet count. She had a bleeding of "easy bleeding" with frequent bleeding of the gums, epistaxis, cutaneous bleeding and menorrhagia, further testing revealed a deficiency of Von willebrand factor. Which of the following thrombogenic processes involving platelets is most directly impaired? Options: 0: Adhesion | 1: Aggregation | 2: Formation of fibrinogen bridges | 3: Conformational change with activation of phospholipid surface
the correct answer is option 0: adhesion
Medical question: Ifa Panchayat is dissolved, elections are to be held within? Options: 0: 1 month | 1: 3 months | 2: 6 months | 3: 1 year
the correct answer is option 2: 6 months
Medical question: Stomach is derived from ? Options: 0: Foregut | 1: Midgut | 2: Hindgut | 3: Allantois
the correct answer is option 0: foregut

Medical question: Which of the following is the main enzyme responsible for activation of xenobiotics? Options: 0: Cytochrome P-450 | 1: Glucuronyl transferase | 2: Glutathione S-transferase | 3: NADPH cytochrome P-450-reductase
the correct answer is option 0: cytochrome p-450
Medical question: In Familial hypercholesterolemia there is deficiency of Options: 0: LDL receptor | 1: Apoprotein A | 2: Apo protein C | 3: Lipoprotein lipase
the correct answer is option 0: ldl receptor
Medical question: Botulinum affects all of the following, EXCEPT: Options: 0: Neuromuscular junction | 1: Preganglionic junction | 2: Post ganglionic nerves | 3: CNS
the correct answer is option 3: cns

Medical question: Which of the following is a poor prognostic factor for childhood ALL. Options: 0: Total Leukocyte count 4000-100,000 | 1: Age < 2 years | 2: Testicular involvement | 3: Blasts in peripheral smear
the correct answer is option 2: testicular involvement

Medical question: Relining of complete denture is not indicated when Options: 0: Denture contains broken teeth | 1: There is excessive resorption of the ridge | 2: Vertical dimension is excessively reduced and has to be changed | 3: Centric relation does not coincide with centric occlusion
the correct answer is option 2: vertical dimension is excessively reduced and has to be changed

Medical question: Which of the following condition is necessary prerequisite for this change? Options: 0: Rupture of membranes | 1: Scanty liquor amnii | 2: Adequate liquor amnii | 3: Air inside the uterine cavity
the correct answer is option 2: adequate liquor amnii

Medical question: Savita is 32 weeks pregnant presents in causality and diagnosed as a case of APH. Vitals are unstable with BP 80/60 which of the following is next step in M/n Options: 0: Careful observation | 1: Blood transfusion | 2: Medical induction of labour | 3: Immediate cesarean section
the correct answer is option 1: sanguis transfusion

Medical question: All are true about Cancer breast, except: Options: 0: Affected sibling is a risk factor | 1: Paget's disease of nipple is intraductal type of CA | 2: Common in aged nulliparous | 3: Increased incidence with prolonged breast feeding
the correct answer is option 3: increased incidence with prolonged breast feeding
Medical question: Which of the following vitamin reduces the risk of insulin resistance, obesity, and the metabolic syndrome? Options: 0: Vitamin A | 1: Vitamin C | 2: Vitamin D | 3: Vitamin B12
the correct answer is option 2: vitamin d
Medical question: The following drugs have significant drug interactions with digoxin except: Options: 0: Cholestyramine | 1: Thiazide diuretics | 2: Quinidine | 3: Amlodipine
the correct answer is option 3: amlodipine

Medical question: Antiboiotic Prophylaxis for infective endocarditis is indicated in: Options: 0: Isolated secundum ASD | 1: Mitral valve prolapse without regurgitation | 2: Prior coronary aery bypass graft | 3: Coarctation of aoa
the correct answer is option 3: coarctation of aoa
Medical question: Adder Head" appearance is found in: Options: 0: X-ray | 1: USG | 2: IVP | 3: CT
the correct answer is option 2: ivp

Medical question: Ortolani's test is done for Options: 0: Congenial dislocation of the knee joints | 1: Congenital dislocation of the hip joints | 2: Congenital dislocation of the shoulder joints | 3: Congenital dislocation of the elbow joints
the correct answer is option 1: congenital dislocation of the hip joints

Medical question: A 50 year old female patient complains of difficulty in swallowing. Patient gives h/o multiple diagnostic CT-scans of the head and neck region. This patient may be predominantly susceptible to which of the following? Options: 0: Medullary thyroid carcinoma | 1: Follicular thyroid carcinoma | 2: Anaplastic thyroid carcinoma | 3: Papillary thyroid carcinoma
the correct answer is option 3: papillary thyroid carcinoma

Medical question: Secondary retention for a removable partial denture is provided by Options: 0: The indirect retainer | 1: The direct retainer | 2: Intimate contact between the denture bases and the underlying tissues | 3: Direct and indirect retainers
the correct answer is option 2: intimate contact between the denture bases and the underlying tissues
